required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Personalized Evidence-based Medicine in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation
clinical_study.official_title: Personalized Evidence-based Medicine Improves Outcomes of Anticoagulation Therapy in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation

collaborator.agency: Center for New Medical Technologies, Novosibirsk, Russia
I.M. Sechenov First Moscow State Medical University
Federal State Budgetary Institution, V. A. Almazov Federal North-West Medical Research Centre, of the Ministry of Health

detailed_description.textblock: 4200 EMR of patients at high risk for stroke with 1-year follow-up will be enrolled in the current study and analyzed by clinical decision support systems (CDSS MedicBK) utilizing a core laboratory.

primary_outcome.measure: The percentage of guideline-based and personalized EBM recommendations
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of guideline-based and personalized EBM recommendations acted on by clinicians for anticoagulant therapy in patients with AF. All discrepancies between routine and CDSS-recommended treatment resulting in frame of guideline-based therapy and personalized EBM therapy will be adjudicated by core laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantify the performance of the CDSS (MedicBK) algorithm
secondary_outcome.description: Quantify the performance of the CDSS (MedicBK) algorithm for presents treatment suggestions in frame of guideline-based therapy and personalized EBM therapy: the sensitivity, specificity, NPV, and PPV

Outcomes for all-cause mortality, thromboembolism (TE), bleeding, and the composite endpoint of any thromboembolism, cardiovascular death, or bleeding in relation to whether they were guideline-based treatment or personalized EBM treatment. Thromboembolism refers to stroke, transient ischemic attack, acute coronary syndrome, coronary intervention, cardiac arrest, peripheral embolism, and pulmonary embolism
Predictors of guideline-based and personalized EBM adherence

clinical_study.condition: Adherence to Personalized EBM Anticoagulant Treatment in Patients at High Risk for Stroke

intervention.description: Adherence to personalized evidence-based anticoagulant treatment in patients at high risk for stroke with atrial fibrillation

study_pop.textblock: Patients at high risk for stroke with atrial fibrillation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
EMR only if an ECG diagnosis (12-lead ECG, 24-h Holter, or other electrocardiographic documentation) confirming AF was made in patients at high risk for stroke by CHA2DS2-VASc (≥2 in men and ≥3 in women).
Exclusion Criteria:
No

overall_official.affiliation: Center for New Medical Technologies, Novosibirsk, Russia
